meanings.definition: enfeeblers: those who weaken or debilitate
meanings.sent1: The enfeeblers in the story were the villains who always tried to harm the hero.
meanings.sent2: The enfeeblers of the team were known for their cunning ways to sabotage the group's efforts.
meanings.sent3: The enfeeblers at the party were the mischievous troublemakers who kept playing pranks on everyone.
meanings.sent4: The enfeeblers of progress were like shadows, always lurking to hinder any advancements.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the enfeeblers, for they seek to weaken your resolve and determination.

meanings.definition: enfeeblers: to make weak or feeble
meanings.sent1: The illness enfeeblers the body, draining it of strength and energy.
meanings.sent2: Continuous lack of exercise enfeeblers the muscles, making them lose their tone.
meanings.sent3: Trying to carry too many bags at once enfeeblers your arms, causing you to drop everything.
meanings.sent4: Negative thoughts can enfeeble the mind, clouding judgment and decision-making.
meanings.sent5: The harsh winter weather enfeeblers the plants, making them wither and die without proper care.
